what new change the calculation the sessions metric effective date february what changing the sessions metric calculated counting sessions reported the sdk the app starting the effective date the sessions metric calculated taking into account minimum time between sessions timer this means that some sessions aren counted illustrated the example that follows the timer has default duration minutes and the possible values are minutes hours example sessions counting with minimum time between sessions minutes this example the sessions reporting times are stated minutes elapsed since example session reporting times number sessions counted sessions disregarded none impact the change expect reduction the sessions metric starting from the effective date the analytics tools and sessions raw data available clients having data locker network partners you consume the session event via postbacks expect reduction due this change what staying the same implementation this change using the default setting minutes won affect any the following metrics metrics daily active users dau monthly active users mau retention loyal users using the default setting app opens engagement conversions including deep linking historical data sessions recorded before the effective date however going forward consider that the minimum time between sessions increased more than one hour and users don open the app many times day then some retention metrics can impacted this especially true the case apps where users typically open the app once day optional setting change needed you can change the default setting minutes one that suits your users behavior and interaction style with the app change the minimum time between sessions duration appsflyer configuration app settings set minimum time between sessions click save settings the change takes effect within hour list what new appsflyer

service providers esp deep linking challenges ios universal links implementing deep linking using universal links developers need associate their apps with specific domains perform deep linking with universal links this security measure ios and above that ensures that only specific domains can launch associated apps developers that use the appsflyer onelink solution associate onelink domain with their app when user clicks onelink launches the app that associated with the developer then gathers information from the appsflyer sdk for deep linking and customizing the user experience issues with links emails from esps esps wrap links emails with their own links they order measure and report engagements however this practice could break the onelink flow not handled properly the app doesn launch and results broken user experience some esps support ios universal links while wrapping the links with their own measurement links apps launch when users click links the emails however the onelink flow still breaks which results the following measurement engagements clicks appsflyer end app launch not attributed click appsflyer sdk doesn pass attribution data the app developer the solution appsflyer appsflyer joins forces with prominent esps order solve the problem with broken deep linking the solution combines several technologies esp link branding via branded links apple app site association appsflyer sdk the combination these technologies allows the sdk resolve the underlying onelink even though wrapped other links the sdk resolves the underlying onelink able provide the developer with the necessary information for deep linking and customizing the user experience the following esps fully support appsflyer solution for deep linking with universal links emails braze iterable oracle responsys salesforce sendgrid other esps require some additional work during integration ensure smooth onelink deep linking experience android app links android developers might experience similar problem with app links however deep linking using uri scheme still widely supported android what this means that developers can still use uri scheme deep link from emails that are sent esps

glance prevent attribution fraudulent activities using the apple install validation service for any ios install both organic and non organic receipt validation flow the receipt validation flow follows the appsflyer sdk gathers the apple install receipt data and sends with the launch message the appsflyer servers the appsflyer servers validate this receipt data via the apple install validation service the apple install validation service responds with error codes indicating that the install invalid the install rejected and does not appear our dashboard the network does not receive postback api call for the invalidated install the install and all the corresponding app events are logged the protect raw data reports installs and blocked app events notes the appsflyer ios sdk version must ios devices with ios version are supported for install validation there are cases where apple does not provide install receipt data and such appsflyer considers this valid install terms app store install validation however protect can block this install due other fraud reasons

glance test your windows app integration with appsflyer currently there way testing with windows referrer other than upload the app the windows app store when testing with windows referrer you must familiar with the following restrictions you must logged the store you must not have the windows anniversary update your device your device must never have had the app windows referrer lifetime even you are allowlisted have waited over days you will not receive referrer attribution test sdk integration required test the sdk integration registered test device register your test device follow the steps here open the appsflyer dashboard and chose the app you are testing select sdk integration tests from the navigation menu you are presented with three options test non organic install app events deep linking testing non organic install select one your registered devices from the dropdown list select where you are installing the app from windows store other scan the generated code with your registered test device and follow the instructions your device wait until the non organic install registered the integration test page indicating the test was successful this can take two minutes the app did not register non organic install this time see the troubleshooting guide displayed the integration test page testing app events select one your registered test devices from the dropdown menu and click next open your app and start generating app events you will see log these events they are registered real time testing deep linking onelink must defined for your app test deep linking see onelink guide select one your registered test devices from the drop down menu and click next scan the code with your registered test device and follow the instructions your device wait until the deep link registered successfully the integration test page

appsflyer invoice depends number factors determined your plan including units used for the growth plan your invoice calculated and issued monthly based the number units used during the month for enterprise packages the number units used deducted from total package units premium features premium features are charged add ons your plan examples premium features include protect mobile fraud protection xpend cost data audiences pivot table and data locker and more learn more about these features and their potential benefits for your business check with your csm contact hello appsflyer com what unit the unit which your invoices are based defined your plan you can find the plan page your appsflyer account possible invoice units are described the following table unit description learn more non organic installs noi attributed new app installs overview dashboard billing for ios apps engagements existing users engage retargeting campaign which leads app launches overview dashboard attributions former users engage retargeting campaign which leads new app installs and app launches overview dashboard monthly active users mau number unique users who opened the app during the month activity dashboard metrics app events any action performed user app following the install for example login complete tutorial purchase achieved game level etc rich app events guide non direct web conversions for pba packages any user action your website that you designated conversion and was attributed referred visit originating from web campaign people based attribution pba billing for ios apps with the introduction ios appsflyer utilizes two methods determine campaign performance and attribution for ios apps aggregated skadnetwork data validated appsflyer appsflyer privacy centric rta real time attribution these two methods run independently and parallel appsflyer performs side side comparison the number daily conversions measured skadnetwork and those measured appsflyer rta for each media source the higher the two numbers will taken into account for billing this ensures that you will never charged twice for the same conversion event learn more about appsflyer ios billing policy usage reports for detailed listing all units used during calendar month download usage report from the plan page important notes about usage reports permissions usage reports and invoices are calculated based the utc time zone result you might notice slight discrepancies between usage reports and the data reported dashboards cohort reports and other aggregated reports each calendar month usage report available from the day the following month for example the first day you can download the report for may june usage reports are available for months from the report month usage reports are not supported for mau plans usage reports are downloadable only admins and account users with all the following permissions access plan and payments pages access all apps media sources and geos glance data appsflyer either lifetime value ltv activity ltv data related installs occurring during the specified date range activity data all events occurring during the specified date range ltv activity there are two methods for analyzing user event data event data relates actions performed users post installation such app purchases registrations and level completions appsflyer event data available grouped the user acquisition date the event chronological date data grouped user acquisition date referred lifetime value ltv data grouped chronologically referred activity important understand what they mean and where they found note that installs are neither ltv nor activity activity data activity data are the events performed active app users during specified date range because activity data shows breakdown chronological events useful for measuring the overall performance media sources during specific date ranges for example use activity data see how many purchase events were performed all app users during specific month use activity data compare user behavior the current month relative previous month ltv data ltv data are the events performed during the lifetime user who converted installed the app specific date range for example use ltv data see the roi the present day users who installed your app during specific month events performed users who converted installed the app before the specified date range are not shown ltv data even the event occurred within that range ltv data tool that shows the quality users from different media sources campaign optimization depends ltv data advertisers find both types data useful but for different purposes for this reason both are available what data can you use compare media sources which pages and reports can you compare appsflyer how you compare ltv and activity data the train analogy this analogy will help you understand the difference between ltv and activity data activity imagine you watching passing train the train passes you see only the actions performed the passengers the train they pass this activity data ltv now imagine that you board train observer the train divided into railroad cars you board the car with other passengers the departure platform this the install during the journey you able observe all the actions performed the passengers the car you observe the actions these passengers until passenger deboards the train this uninstall you aren able view the actions passengers other railroad cars because they boarded the train before after you this then ltv appsflyer dashboards ltv activity the dashboards enable marketers optimize their non organic traffic most the dashboards and reports the platform are ltv based marketers typically measure performance ltv basis let explore which data ltv and which activity overview dashboard the overview dashboard display ltv views available user acquisition retargeting unified metrics available user acquisition retargeting revenue and campaign costs charts use acquisition trend installs lifetime loyal users and lifetime revenue these columns the table are calculated using ltv data sessions loyal users number and rate glance measure the incremental lift generated retargeting campaigns related reading running incrementality experiment audiences incrementality blog the incrementality testing guide for marketers what incrementality probably the best way understand incrementality analysis through example say you recently ran remarketing campaign for the sake simplicity say was with only one network the campaign conversion rate was now you want evaluate the success the campaign and you need answer important and course the most difficult questions good conversion rate for this campaign how know that the campaign truly resulted driving additional conversions was the campaign worth the cost running order answer these questions accurately and without bias must consider more than just measured conversions must take into account the number users who would have converted organically even they had never engaged with remarketing campaign this difference between total conversions and those that would have happened anyway known incremental lift sometimes simply lift and critical determining the true value campaign can quite difficult measure but that precisely what appsflyer incrementality designed incrementality experiments incrementality overcomes the challenge measuring incremental lift allowing you create scientifically valid experiments compare the behavior similar groups these groups vary only that some groups the test groups are exposed your campaign and one group the control group not learn more about creating and running incrementality experiments calculation methodology the following sections explain the calculations behind the numbers reported the incrementality dashboard lift appsflyer incrementality employs alternative methods for calculating lift intent treat reach based while reach based methodology preferable for purposes evaluating campaign performance its calculation requires the measurement data points not provided all networks for these networks intent treat methodology used instead note prior december lift was calculated using solely the intent treat method however data for earlier dates has been updated utilize reach based lift where applicable therefore you can review historical experiments analyze their results light the new methodology itt based lift intent treat itt experimental methodology has its foundations medical science using itt researchers randomly split given population between control group who are not treated and test group whom researchers intend treat researchers measure the efficacy given treatment comparing the results the groups whether not test group member actually received treatment not taken into account similarly remarketing the lift metric measures campaign efficacy doesn matter user the test group actually engaged with campaign received treatment because the intent that relevant calculating incrementality other words results are calculated every member the test group actually engaged with the campaign when used appsflyer incrementality uses itt based lift calculation for srns although not the preferred method for measuring lift our context itt remains scientifically sound experimental method and provides valid results when reach based calculation not possible interpreting results the underlying assumption that all members the test group were actually reached campaign often results low conversion rates and consequence low incremental lift reach based lift its name implies reach based lift calculation takes into account whether not member the test group was actually reached served campaign prior converting addition requiring additional data reach based lift calculation also more complex that requires certain mathematical adjustments the control group order statistically valid these adjustments are cumulatively known the creation counterfactual control group when used appsflyer incrementality uses reach based lift calculation for non srns attribution link networks while the preferred method for calculating lift reach based calculation requires that networks report the following data appsflyer impression data campaign from the attribution link this data not reported incrementality measurement not available and displays the incrementality dashboard interpreting results since reach based lift calculation takes into account only test group members that were actually reached campaign networks that are measured using reach based incrementality will usually show amplified results positive lift will become much higher and negative lift will become much lower best practices because the different lift calculation methodologies can yield significantly different results the following best practices are recommended order make interpretation more meaningful when creating your experiments select audiences that are split only among control group and one more networks the same type either attribution link networks non srns for reach based calculation srns for itt based calculation your initial experiments consider using audience split only between single network and control group this makes less likely that comparisons will made among more networks for which different lift calculations are used statistical significance when evaluating the validity incrementality experiments sound scientific methodology requires that consider statistical significance the level confidence that the lift result isn due random events chance the incrementality dashboard significance reported percentage for each media source the percentage indicates the likelihood that the results for that media source would repeat themselves the experiment were performed again under similar circumstances statistical significance determined below the dashboard will display unreliable results instead percentage significance affected audience size experiment duration and media source performance scaled control group for test group level metrics opposed per user metrics lift calculated based scaled control group other words the size the control group adjusted match the control group size for each media source example assume the following scenario test group size for network members control group size members experiment results network had conversions the control group had conversions total conversions will adjusted based assumed scaled control group size members assumed members actual members actual members actual incremental conversions lift will calculated based scaled control group size members and incremental conversions incrementality dashboard accessing glance revenue data helps give you clear and complete picture roi and roas learn about the different products and features available for advertisers aggregate and view revenue data overview revenue one half the roi picture the other half cost when you have accurate revenue data attributed the originating media sources and campaigns you can see the complete picture your roi and roas meaning you can see which networks campaigns and ads bring the most valuable users and not just installs engagements adjust your spend and marketing campaigns accordingly advanced revenue reporting premium products there are three main sources for generating revenue app purchases this includes revenue from the sale any products services inside your app appsflyer able automatically validate and measure revenue from app purchases including pending purchases purchases refunds cancellations taxes app store commissions etc learn more about setup and reporting subscription revenue this includes revenue deriving from subscriptions your app services also includes any changes subscriptions including upgrades cancellations refunds etc learn more about setup and reporting revenue this includes revenue generated hosting ads and displaying them your app users for example your app can display ads from other apps your users click these ads you generate revenue for each click learn more about revenue setup and reporting basic revenue reporting appsflyer provides basic revenue measurement tools these tools are less robust than the advanced revenue reporting methods and require substantial amount configuration your developers but they don require subscription premium products revenue recording via customized app events you can also share this data with networks via postbacks note consider using validated app purchases premium product include the automatic measurement refunds taxes app store commissions etc app purchase receipt validation subscription revenue measurement

permissions the maximum number users per account determined your subscription plan each user permissions are defined along primary dimensions role capabilities access features and perform functions app access for current and future apps data access media source and geo important certain appsflyer dashboards and features are unavailable users with limited data access media sources and geos these dashboards and features are listed here permissions within each these dimensions are assigned independently other words you may assign user role with broad functional capabilities but allow them exercise those capabilities only within narrowly defined set apps media sources and geos the only exception the admin role discussed below which has access all capabilities apps media sources and geos more about roles predefined roles hash each user your appsflyer account must assigned role each role defines the specific appsflyer features the user can access and the functions they can perform full list capabilities per role available the roles tab the user management page roles within appsflyer can predefined roles custom roles certain circumstances temp roles predefined roles appsflyer configured with many predefined roles admin team manager marketing lead marketing marketing limited contributor accounting security quality assurance for each these predefined roles the functional capabilities are fixed mixing and matching allowed however you can change user functional capabilities any time assigning them different predefined custom role except for the account owner discussed below example you have assigned bill bates the role team manager this role gives bill the ability manage onelink templates but does not allow him access the plan and payments pages question can keep bill the team manager role but also give him the ability access the plan and payments pages can take away his ability manage onelink templates answer long bill stays the team manager role you cannot give him the ability access the plan and payments pages nor can you remove his ability manage onelink templates course you can assign bill different predefined role and his capabilities will change those defined that role you can create custom role for bill that changes his capabilities according your needs custom roles the predefined roles appsflyer have been configured with the specific combinations capabilities required most situations for this reason many advertisers find that they don need further customize roles however when additional customization required predefined roles are glance the differences between people based attribution pba and google analytics pba compared google analytics pba and google analytics are web analytics and conversion measurement solutions each focuses different measurement aspects pba also offers additional benefits pba independent unbiased attribution authority that focuses attribution measurement pba attributes conversions and revenue media sources and campaigns that bring users your website google analytics focuses more web analytics gathers analyzes and aggregates data related user behavior with google analytics you can analyze for example user behavior funnels web events benefits pba over google analytics the following are the benefits pba over google analytics pba includes web app measurement this metric tells you how many users move from your website your app also tells you which media sources and campaigns bring users your website who subsequently install your app raw data for conversions and events that you can pull into your own systems this gives you the ability and power run your analysis reasons for differences you compare data from pba and google analytics refer the following reasons for differences data sdk implementation the way you implement pba and google analytics could affect data collection google analytics shows more sessions and visitors cause google analytics loads before the web sdk users that bounce users that spend short periods time your website are not counted pba this causes discrepancies data for sessions and visitors solution strongly recommend positioning the web sdk such that loads early possible whether you load the sdk directly through google tag manager late loading the sdk can cause significant discrepancies google analytics shows more data for sessions campaign and conversions cause the web sdk present only certain pages google analytics present all pages result google analytics collects data from all over your website whereas the web sdk collects data only from certain pages this causes discrepancies data for sessions visitors campaigns and conversions solution implement the web sdk all pages your website dashboard settings dashboard settings such timezone and data filter could affect how data presented you timezone settings discrepancies data cause the timezone settings your google analytics are different from those your pba dashboard you might encounter discrepancies example your appsflyer dashboard configured utc and your dashboard configured utc this means that your dashboard ahead your appsflyer dashboard one day therefore data that appears the appsflyer dashboard for march only appears your dashboard you choose march the date range filter solution make sure time zone settings are the same both appsflyer and google analytics data filters discrepancies data issue both appsflyer and google analytics allow you filter data according date attributed media sources campaigns and events different filters appsflyer and google analytics can generate different views for the same data solution when you compare data from the two dashboards make sure filters are applied the data set conversions and events different attribution models lookback windows how you send events and cookie settings can all affect data collection and processing lookback window discrepancies conversion measurement cause you have different lookback windows google analytics and pba discrepancies might occur attribution data solution pba lookback window always days make sure set day lookback window google analytics when you choose your attribution model attribution model discrepancies conversion measurement cause different attribution models pba and google analytics can cause discrepancies attribution data solution google analytics offers default attribution models that you can choose from however pba operates last non direct touch day lookback window attribution model make sure choose last non direct touch attribution model google analytics sending events issue both google analytics sdk and the web sdk allow you send events you implement one logic for sending events google analytics and another for sending events pba discrepancies might arise solution when you send events verify the following make sure that the same trigger applies both make sure you send the event both google analytics and pba click here learn how send events using the web sdk cookies both pba and google analytics use cookies recognize users cookie settings google analytics although recommended let google analytics sdk automatically handle cookie settings you can still configure and change cookie settings any change cookie settings might cause discrepancies setting cookie expiration google analytics allows you set cookie expiry you set the google analytics cookie expire before the web sdk cookie does might cause discrepancies example mark constant visitor your website for over year now and considers subscribing premium content your developer set the google analytics cookie expire after year the web sdk however sets the cookie expire after two years when mark finally subscribes and conversion registered the google analytics cookie longer valid and another set its stead the end result that google analytics shows two users both them are mark with only one them having conversion associated with pba however shows one user for mark and the same user that has conversion associated with this means that your conversion rate google analytics lower than that pba setting cookie subdomain google analytics allows you set cookies for subdomains whereas pba only sets cookies the top level domain example you set cookie the subdomain store mywebsite com sharon visits your website and then goes your online store store mywebsite com google analytics considers her two different users since pba only sets cookies the top level domain mywebsite com considers sharon mywebsite com and store mywebsite com the same user the end result two users google analytics and one user pba

glance find the leading causes attribution discrepancies between appsflyer and app stores well tips minimize these discrepancies attribution discrepancies there are inherent differences the attribution models used all players the mobile attribution ecosystem the same applies appsflyer and the main app stores ios app store and android google play note this article the two stores are referred app store app stores because the differences attribution models some instances the app store records more installs than appsflyer other instances appsflyer records more installs than the app store note discrepancies not affect the accuracy the non organic installs count because the appsflyer attribution model credits one install per click this true even for specific user with more than one device registered the app store why appsflyer attributes less the following are reasons for under attribution appsflyer cause app stores appsflyer appsflyer tip install definitions app stores record installs after the user downloads and installs the app whether the user later launches the app not appsflyer records new installs only after the first launch users that never launch are not counted appsflyer even they download and install according the app store definition about mobile app downloads result least one launch but this can vary significantly different geos and verticals install record date app stores record the date the download the day install appsflyer records the date the first launch the day install appsflyer use longer periods time your queried date range minimize this discrepancy time zones data displays according the local time zone the advertiser default data displays using utc time zone you can set the app preferred time zone reduce this discrepancy details here android user uninstalls and installs within the defined attribution window some views google play shows two unique installs for the same user regardless the time that elapsed from the first install other views show unique users and therefore are more closely aligned with appsflyer inside the attribution window default months from the original install time the user not considered new appsflyer when installing you can set the attribution window from months ios user uninstalls and installs inside the defined attribution window itunes counts new install every time the user uninstalls and installs inside the attribution window default months from the original install time the user not considered new appsflyer when installing you can set the attribution window from months why appsflyer attributes more the following are reasons for over attribution appsflyer cause app stores appsflyer appsflyer tip upgrading existing app install from version that did not contain the appsflyer sdk version that contains the appsflyer sdk the app stores regard this the same user not new install appsflyer shows the upgrade organic installs this peak usually drops after few days most users finish upgrading the app new accounts may wish migrate their existing users appsflyer prevent this peak device reset and limit tracking fraud app stores regard this the same user not new install appsflyer sees new install new device appsflyer protect anti fraud solution detects your app suffering from these types fraud installs coming from out store markets and pre installs google play does not record these installs appsflyer counts these installs you advertising out store android market consult the documentation for the correct setup

glance learn about the appsflyer sdk version control policy and what versions maintain related reading for complete picture the appsflyer version control policy sure read these articles appsflyer version control policy this article appsflyer android sdk release notes appsflyer ios sdk release notes about versioning throughout the years appsflyer has released many versions the sdk each sdk version calls specific api version the intent the version control policy define how long api will serve the sdk versions why need version control the purpose version control includes the following helps you understand advance when api for the sdk versions that are integrated into your apps will sunset this important because version adoption takes time meaning may take some time until your users upgrade newer app version improves stability backward compatibility for years thus eliminating unexpected errors when using very old sdk versions lets you take advantage new features that require sdk upgrades sdk version lifecycles api version guaranteed run for years whenever new major minor version the sdk released appsflyer will set sunset date for the previous minor version including all its patch versions what happens when sdk version sunset once version the sdk sunset appsflyer servers will longer measure installs sessions and app events events that reach these endpoints will simply rejected since adoption takes time highly recommended that your developer upgrade the latest sdk version well advance the sunset date

glance learn about the appsflyer sdk version control policy and what versions maintain related reading for complete picture the appsflyer version control policy sure read these articles appsflyer version control policy this article appsflyer android sdk release notes appsflyer ios sdk release notes about versioning throughout the years appsflyer has released many versions the sdk each sdk version calls specific api version the intent the version control policy define how long api will serve the sdk versions why need version control the purpose version control includes the following helps you understand advance when api for the sdk versions that are integrated into your apps will sunset this important because version adoption takes time meaning may take some time until your users upgrade newer app version improves stability backward compatibility for years thus eliminating unexpected errors when using very old sdk versions lets you take advantage new features that require sdk upgrades sdk version lifecycles api version guaranteed run for years whenever new major minor version the sdk released appsflyer will set sunset date for the previous minor version including all its patch versions what happens when sdk version sunset once version the sdk sunset appsflyer servers will longer measure installs sessions and app events events that reach these endpoints will simply rejected since adoption takes time highly recommended that your developer upgrade the latest sdk version well advance the sunset date

attribution windows etc however discrepancy between the two dashboards expected advertisers should rely the appsflyer dashboard the source truth when evaluating cpi and performance advertisers should aware the following causes and consider taking the necessary actions source discrepancies and solutions set out below are number causes discrepancies and possible solutions different lookback windows default snapchat ads manager and appsflyer have different attribution windows lookback window snapchat ads manager appsflyer click attribution lookback window days days default can configured days view through attribution lookback window day day default can configured hours solutions configure the attribution window appsflyer match snapchat default values advertisers can select attribution windows the ads manager dashboard match what they have set default their attribution partner mmp dashboard contact your snapchat csm have your account allowlisted activate this feature time zone differences default ads manager uses pst timezone whereas appsflyer uses utc default result for example snapchat might attribute install friday while appsflyer attributes saturday solution configure pst the timezone for each app appsflyer click here for details how change the time zone for existing apps multi channel source attribution user might engage with for the same app multiple platforms especially with very large multi platform campaigns when the user installs the app multiple platforms may take credit for the install snapchat ads manager counts each install occurring within the attribution window install attributed snapchat attributes app events days after install appsflyer applies last touch attribution and credits only the last platform show the user that led install attributes app events the source the install days this can lead discrepancies high between appsflyer and snapchat ads manager solution snapchat just one mobile application whereas other platforms own multiple mobile applications mobile networks exchanges due their additional reach across multiple properties possible that competitors might win the last touch yet snapchat still driving significant value ultimately appsflyer should the dashboard used evaluate ecpi and performance when there discrepancy default appsflyer the source truth keep mind that fully evaluate the impact your snapchat campaigns you should work with appsflyer keep record the volume conversions where snapchat was contributor the conversion but was not the last touch there value understanding this even you attribute based the last touch manage the discrepancy advertisers should keep records the approximate percentage total conversions for which snapchat was contributor but not the last contributor and such create new ecpi goal for snapchat based this approximate delta

what new version introduced some changes the way the sdk handling the various requests the appsflyer servers noticed that there are apps that try and send app events before they have started the sdk introducing this change making sure things are executed the right order what changing before the change earlier versions the sdk the app could send app events appsflyer before calling the sdk start method which means before the conversion was sent the server after the change starting with this version the conversion request prioritized and all the app events that take place before calling start are stored and wait for the conversion request sent

glance prevent install postbacks and send only specific app event for example purchase postback networks effectively run cpa campaigns introduction when you run cpa cost per action mobile campaign installs that come from these attribution links are still attributed aggregated and presented normally appsflyer dashboards and data according your agreement with the network you are charged for actions only within certain period after install you can also disable postbacks after this period this article explains how disable postbacks both cases important disabling install postbacks can cause serious reconciliation problems between advertisers and networks not agreed upon advance advertisers and networks must have consent from one another before starting disable postbacks preventing
